overview: Sure Start Maternity Grant - a £500 payment to help with the costs of a new baby - eligibility, apply, claim form SF100
title: Sure Start Maternity Grant

table.body:
You could get a one-off payment of £500 to help towards the costs of your first child. This is known as a Sure Start Maternity Grant.

Usually you [qualify](/sure-start-maternity-grant#eligibility "Eligibility") for the money if: 

+ you've no other children - unless you're expecting a multiple birth (eg twins) 
+ you're on a low income
+ you get certain benefits

^ You don’t have to pay the grant back and it won't affect your other benefits or tax credits. ^
table.title: Overview

table.body:
A Sure Start Maternity Grant is £500 and you don't have to pay it back. 

You get £500 for each baby if you have a multiple birth. 

##If you already have children 

If you already have children you won't get a grant unless you're  expecting a multiple birth (eg twins). 

How much you get depends on the number of babies expected and the number of children you already have. 

Number of children already | Grant (if you have a multiple birth)
- | - 
You have 1 or more | £500 for all but 1 new baby 
You have 1 or more from a previous multiple birth | £500 for the number of babies expected minus the number of existing children

$E
**Example**  

Grant it you have 2 children aged 6 and 8 and are expecting triplets - £1000.

Grant if you have twins aged 8 and are expecting triplets - £500.  

Grant if you have twins aged 8 and are expecting twins - £0
$E

##How you're paid

All benefits, pensions and allowances are paid [into an account](/how-to-have-your-benefits-paid "How to have your benefits paid"), eg your bank account.
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
Usually, to qualify for a Sure Start Maternity Grant there must be no other children in your family and you must get one of these benefits:

- Income Support
- income-based Jobseeker's Allowance
- income-related Employment and Support Allowance
- Pension Credit
- Child Tax Credit at a rate higher than the family element
- Working Tax Credit that includes a disability or severe disability element 

^ You must claim by the [deadline](/sure-start-maternity-grant#eligibility "How to claim"). ^

##Exception 

If you already have children you won’t get a grant unless you’re expecting a [multiple birth](sure-start-maternity-grant#what-youll-get "What you'll get") (eg twins or triplets).

##If you're not giving birth 

You can get a grant if (for example) you're adopting or becoming a surrogate parent. 

On the date you claim the baby must not be more than 1 year old and one of the following must apply: 

- the baby has been placed with you for adoption 
- you've got permission to adopt a baby from abroad 
- you've got a parental order for a surrogate birth 
- you've been appointed as guardian 
- you've an adoption or a residence order
- you're become responsible for the baby and you're not the mother
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
Send form SF100 to the address below by the deadline. There's a different form and postal address for [Northern Ireland.](http://www.nidirect.gov.uk/index/information-and-services/money-tax-and-benefits/benefits-and-financial-support/expecting-or-bringing-up-children/sure-start-maternity-grant.htm "nidirect government services website"){:rel="external"}  

$D[Download 'Form SF100, Sure Start Maternity Grant claim form' (PDF, 90KB)](http://www.dwp.gov.uk/advisers/claimforms/sf100_print.pdf "Form SF100, Sure Start Maternity Grant claim form' (PDF, 90KB)")$D

##Deadlines 

You must claim within 11 weeks of expecting the baby or within 3 months of the birth. 

If you’re becoming responsible for a child, eg through adoption, you must claim within 3 months of this happening (eg the child being placed with you).

##Where to send your form 

Take it to your local Jobcentre Plus or post it. 

$A
Freepost Plus RSCE-EATS-AHAK
Wembley BDC
PO Box 110
London SW95 9EA
$A

##What you need to know 

A health professional (eg doctor or midwife) must also sign your claim form. 

You'll get a letter telling you if your claim was successful.

##Appeal a decision

You can appeal the decision about your Sure Start Maternity Grant if you're unhappy with it. 

$D
[Download 'Leaflet GL24, Appeal against a benefit decision' (PDF, 4915KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@benefits/documents/digitalasset/dg_201702.pdf "Download 'Leaflet GL24, Appeal against a benefit decision' (PDF, 4915KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D
